page.title: 13RISELEY - REVITALISED
page.content: In the 1950's Riseley was one of Bedfordshires dying villages. Changes in agricultural methods and two wars had left the village with a population of less than 500. During the 1960's a building policy was implemented to reverse this decline. The secondary school was built,as were small estates of both council and private houses. These developments attracted residents who worked in towns,but who wanted to live in a village. Now in the 1980's small developments of desirable residences are still being built and many old properties renovated and enlarged. Busy,lively with a population of over 1000 now,it supports a picture gallery,in a disused chapel,craft shop,builder, thatcher,garage etc. It is picturesque,prosperous and pleasant.
